opinion: I love coming here and buying loafs of bread
Packed with tourists but what would you expect
Fig and Brie is always a great pick
I love boudins, it is always good when I go and I am never disappointed
high quality and the price is reasonable
not the best place for clam chowder in the city, but does it satisfy my need for clam chowder? Absolutely.
a few slices of that special sourdough
They also have really good deals, like their Best of Boudin combo, which is soup and your choice of a salad or sandwich, for around $8 bucks.
I am part of the frequent buyers program, which allows me to get $3 off a meal, when you rack up enough points. It also entitles me a loaf of bread every month for a year.
If you don't tip, then expect your order to take a long time and missing items you paid for
worth it to try more things on the menu
a San Francisco company through and through
Chicken cooked under a brick is how all chicken should be cooked
Waiter was good, giving us 2 of their sour dough French loaves for free as we left

I always get the clam chowder (of course) and couple that with the spring salad- its mixed spring greens with candied walnuts, apples, dried cranberries, a bit of feta I believe all with a delicious balsamic vinaigrette. Its the perfect amount of food for a girl- youll be stuffed!
way nicer (and yes more touristy) than anything youd find in Southern California. The menu is also a bit more expanded and they have these cute little bread statues everywhere.
I always go for the soup and salad combo, its solid and only a dollar or two more than the soup by itself.

aspect: Window display of animals made of sourdough bread

opinion: inlike the one in fishermans wharf more because of the atmosphere but this place is really good as well
crab chowder with Boudins famous sourdough bread
small rectangular restaurant that also fantastic for desert and people watching
Too crowded though, many people wanna try the bread bowl
love their clam chowder bread bowl
Sandwiches are ok, I would rather just go somewhere else for a better sandwich
Great place to stop by for a bite to eat
great for the bay area, but cant compete with the chowder from New England
watching the factory make the bread is very entertaining
Great place to relax after a long walk
Have your clam chowder in a sour dough bowl
Cant beat the chowder in a bread bowl
This amazing shop has everything that can satisfy me
amazing bread that will stuff you
more pricey than I remembered but still good. A lunch for 2 was about $20
Bread made fresh daily, as tourists walk by bakers kneading bread behind the windows. Some of the best bread in the world, worth the carbs!
